intro: Osbeckia humbertii, commonly known as Humbert's willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often near rivers or in forest understories. It produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
